recipes.title: Garlic Baked Shrimp

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound(s) raw shrimp deveined and peeled
extendedIngredients.name: raw shrimp

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.In a bowl, combine the shrimp, garlic, and white wine.  Stir to combine, then pour into a baking dish.  Spread out evenly, and then season with salt and pepper.In another bowl, use a fork to mix melted butter, Panko, and parsley until well combined.  With your fingers, sprinkle the mixture evenly in the baking dish over the shrimp.Transfer dish to oven and bake until the shrimp are pink and opaque, about 15-18 minutes.

recipes.title: Blackberry Cake Donuts with Lemon Glaze

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/3 c Blackberry filling (see link in post for recipe)
extendedIngredients.name: blackberry

recipes.instructions: In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt, stirring to combine. In another bowl, combine egg, milk and vanilla extract, mixing together. Add melted butter to the dry ingredients, stir together until crumbs form. Stir in milk and egg mixture, when it's almost combine add the blackberry filling. Combine blackberry filling into a swirl pattern then bring the dough together with a spoon. Using your hands form it into a large ball, then roll it out on a floured surface to about 1/2 inch thickness. Cut donuts using a donut cutter. I fried the holes as well and only re-worked the dough for the extra little scraps that were left. Heat oil in a large pot or deep fryer, bringing it to 375 degrees. Fry donuts 1-2 at a time, frying for about 1 1/2-2 minutes per side. Check donut in center for doneness and adjust heat/cook time for remaining. Drain on a paper towel, drizzle Lemon Glaze over all.Lemon Glaze: Whisk confectioners sugar and lemon juice together until smooth.

recipes.title: Sunday Afternoon Slow-Cooked Spare Ribs

extendedIngredients.originalString: salt and black pepper to taste
extendedIngredients.name: salt and pepper

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tablespoon seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)
extendedIngredients.name: seafood seasoning

recipes.instructions: Place the ribs into a large pot, and cover with lightly salted water. Bring the ribs to a boil, and boil for 45 minutes. Drain off the water and set the ribs aside.Heat the olive oil in a large, heavy pot or Dutch oven over medium heat until the oil shimmers, and brown the ribs on all sides, about 10 minutes per side. Remove the ribs, and pour in the beef broth, ketchup, brown sugar, lemon juice, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, red pepper flakes, seafood seasoning, dried onion, nutmeg, and salt and pepper. Stir the ingredients until the sauce has dissolved any brown bits of flavor from the bottom of the pan. Bring the sauce to a simmer over medium-low heat, and transfer the ribs back into the sauce.Coat the ribs with sauce, cover the pan, and simmer over low heat until the meat is very tender and falls off the bones, about 3 hours.Kitchen-Friendly View

recipes.title: Teatime Mulled Wine

extendedIngredients.originalString: orange slices and whole cloves, for garnish
extendedIngredients.name: orange

extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 750-ml. bottle full-bodied red wine, such as red Zinfandel
extendedIngredients.name: full bodied red wine

recipes.instructions: 1. Insert 3 cloves into skin of each orange quarter. Place orange quarters, wine, sugar and cinnamon sticks in large saucepan, and heat until wine is steaming, but not boiling. Reduce heat to low, cover, and let steam 30 minutes.2. Steep tea in 1 cup boiling water 5 minutes. Remove tea bag, and stir tea into wine mixture. Serve in cups, garnished with orange slices pierced with cloves.

recipes.title: Spaghetti with Beefy Tomato and Pumpkin Sauce
recipes.instructions: In a large skillet over medium heat add oil. Then add onions and cook for 5 minutes to soften. Add ground beef and cook until the beef is no longer pink - about 6 - 8 minutes. Drain and add to a crockpot. Add the remaining ingredients to the crock pot (except pasta), and set on high to cook for 3 hours. If you want it to cook all day, set to low.Cook pasta according to package directions and add to spaghetti sauce when ready to serve.
